title: Mastering Reported Speech Commands
objectives: Understand Reported Speech Commands at Beginner level
Apply Reported Speech Commands in real conversations
Build confidence with Reported Speech Commands

vocabulary.example: She told me to sit down.

content.introduction: Welcome to this lesson on Reported Speech Commands.
content.explanation: In this lesson, you will learn about Reported Speech Commands at the Beginner level.
examples: Example of Reported Speech Commands usage.
tips: Practice Reported Speech Commands daily for best results.

exercises.question: Choose the correct reported speech: 'He said, "Close the door"' ->
options: He told me to close the door.
He said to close the door.
He asked me to close the door.

exercises.question: Convert: 'Please sit here,' she said. -> She ______ me to sit there.
Practice giving a command and reporting it to a partner.

culturalNote: Reporting commands politely is common in American workplaces and schools to ensure clarity and respect.
